radiographic_examinations.findings: Small right pleural effusion, bibasilar atelectasis, transient mosaic enhancement of the liver parenchyma, mild periportal edema, trace upper abdominal ascites, radiodense stone in the gallbladder neck now in the gallbladder fundus with mild gallbladder wall edema, normal pancreas, normal size spleen (10 cm), unremarkable adrenal glands, normal kidneys with no hydronephrosis or masses, normal caliber small and large bowel with mild transverse colitis, and no retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Radiodense stone in gallbladder neck is now in gallbladder fundus and gallbladder is no longer distended.
